column5: +1.Went there the last two years. Lee is great.

My wife and I are planning on taking our daughter and husband on a fishing trip in northwest Ontario. I have made several trips for fishing and moose hunting but it is all fairly new to the others. Our daughter has a small dog that she just has to take with her. Any suggestions for a housekeeping resort that is pet friendly. Thanks
Southbay on Gullrock allows pets, give them a check on the internet.
Lac seul evergreen lodge is pet friendly
If you see a camp that really interests you, I would suggest that you ask them if they would be ok with a small dog...I think a number of camps would likely respond positively.
Witch Bay, our dog loves it there. She is a Goldendoodle and the owner has two Goodledoodles - it's a real Doodlefest for our stay.
I would get in contact with Goldpines Camp located east of Ear Falls. In all the years we've been there, there are always guests who bring along the household pet.
Spruce Island Camp on Lake of The Woods is pet friendly.
Try Sunset Cove resort in Nestor Falls www.sunsetcove resort.net
This is on The Lake of The Woods near Kenora. It's on Pine Portage Bay across from Northern Harbor. Very good rates and great docks if you have a boat. http://www.kenora.net/mackenzielodge/
Try Pickerel Arm Camp near Sioux Lookout. Great folks.
